metadata.synopsis: After more than their share of exploits, best friends Kid and Play (Christopher Reid, Christopher Martin) are growing up: Kid is marrying his girlfriend, Veda, and Play is trying to survive in the music business. But they face major hurdles in their maturation process. While Play plans a bachelor party, handles some raucous younger cousins and deals with the arrival in town of Kid's ex-girlfriend, he also tries to bring success to a new female rap group called Sex as a Weapon.

reviews: There isn't a single laugh to be had...
The weakest film in the House Party series
The party's over. This film feels more like a hangover.
Nope, not even bad enough to be the final installment.
